item.title: Lost in Random: The Eternal Die launches this summer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/lost-in-random-the-eternal-die-launches-this-summer

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

PC demo now now available. Xbox Series demo launches February 14.

Roguelite action adventure game sequel Lost in Random: The Eternal Die will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam this summer, publisher Thunderful Games and developer Stormteller Games announced. It will also be available via Game Pass. A demo will be available for PC starting today, followed by Xbox Series  on February 14.

Here is an overview of the game, via Thunderful Games:

About

In Lost in Random: The Eternal Die, Aleksandra, formerly known as The Queen, and her companion, Fortune, have been captured inside the Black Die by Mare the Knight, who is plotting their final chapter. Players will fight their way through a randomly generated gauntlet where they’ll take on monstrous pawns and giant board games, to claim treasure which improves their chances of defeating Aleksandra’s tormentor. They must use their wits and trusty die companion to escape this living labyrinth, where evil reigns and Random Rules.

Key Features

  • Mastery Meets Chance – Engage in fast-paced, second-to-second combat that blends real-time action with strategic decision-making—and a touch of luck.
  • Forge Your Playstyle – Wield four unique weapons, throw your die-companion, and combine over 100 relics with powerful card-based abilities to unleash devastating synergies.
  • Ever-Changing World – Traverse four randomly generated worlds, each with its own distinct secrets and challenges and face over 30 different enemy types and formidable bosses.
  • A Dark Fantasy Tale – Immerse yourself in a fully voiced story set in a Tim Burton-inspired world, brought to life with hauntingly beautiful landscapes and an enchanting soundtrack.

Watch a new trailer below.

Gameplay Trailer

item.title: Glover for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, and Switch launches February 27
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/glover-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-and-switch-launches-february-27

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

The cult classic platformer returns.

The PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Switch versions of 3D puzzle platformer Glover will launch on February 27, publisher QUByte Interactive announced in cooperation with Bleem! Wishlisting is available now via PlayStation Store, Microsoft Store, and Nintendo eShop.

Glover first launched for Nintendo 64 and PC on November 16, 1998, followed by PlayStation on October 4, 1999. The PC version was released via Steam on April 20, 2022.

Here is an overview of the game, via QUByte Interactive:

About

The cult classic from the ’90s returns! Glover is a charming 3D platformer where you control a magical glove on a quest to restore balance to the kingdom.

Roll, jump, and manipulate your magic ball to solve puzzles, overcome challenges, and defeat the evil glove threatening the world!

Key Features

  • Control Glover and his magical ball through six vibrant worlds filled with secrets, creative platforming, and curious enemies.
  • Switch between different ball forms to overcome obstacles and solve clever puzzles.
  • Discover amazing power-ups that enhance Glover’s abilities and expand your gameplay possibilities.
  • Face off against the evil glove, who will stop at nothing to ensure chaos reigns forever!

item.title: Pixel art high-speed action game FUBUKI ~zero in on Holoearth~ HOLOLIVE ALTERNATIVE announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/pixel-art-high-speed-action-game-fubuki-zero-in-on-holoearth-hololive-alternative-announced-for-pc

Publisher Phoenixx and developer PEPOSOFT have announced pixel art high-speed action game FUBUKI ~zero in on Holoearth~ HOLOLIVE ALTERNATIVE for PC (Steam). It will launch this spring. A demo will be available starting February 25 as part of Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

FUBUKI ~zero in on Holoearth~ HOLOLIVE ALTERNATIVE is a high-speed pixel action game where you control the protagonist, Shirakami Fubuki, and battle using swords and skills.

An Exhilarating 2D Pixel Action Adventure With Fubuki Across Holoearth!

You take control of Shirakami Fubuki, one of the Kami residing in Yamato.

With her beloved sword Murasamemaru, she skillfully performs sword fights, high-speed movement, and even wall jumps with ease.

Fight alongside Fubuki, defeat the “Ayakashi” blocking your path, and resolve the anomalies occurring in Holoearth.

(This game is developed with reference to the world settings of the teaser PV and manga of Hololive Alternative. Please note that some content and expressions may differ from the official settings.)

The world of Holoearth is diverse and ever-changing.

Each stage features a completely different appearance, enemies, and mechanics.

Utilize your player skills and the allies you meet along the way to overcome challenging obstacles.

During your adventure, you may encounter Hololive members who have been corrupted by Kegare and turned hostile.

Defeat them to restore their sanity—they will surely lend you their strength once they are back to normal.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯

item.title: ASTRO BOT – five new weekly speedrun levels and Special Bot updates begin rolling out today
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/astro-bot-five-new-weekly-speedrun-levels-and-special-bot-updates-begin-rolling-out-today

  • PS5

Starting with "Tick-Tock Shock."

Publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment and developer Team ASOBI will release the first in a series of five additional weekly updates for ASTRO BOT starting today at 6:00 a.m. PT / 9:00 a.m. ET, each adding a new speedrun level with a new Special Bot to rescue, the companies announced.

The full release schedule is as follows:

  • February 13 – “Tick-Tock Shock”
  • February 20 – “Thrust or Bust”
  • February 27 – “Cock-A-Doodle-Doom”
  • March 6 – “Hard to Bear”
  • March 13 – “Armored Hardcore”

Each update will be available at 6:00 a.m. PT / 9:00 a.m. ET.

“Unlike our last update ‘Winter Wonder,’ which was a walk through the Xmas park, this new update features harder levels to test your jumping skills,” said Team ASOBI studio director Nicolas Doucet. “Each level comes with a brand-new Special Bot to rescue and, once that’s done, can be replayed in Time Attack mode with online rankings. To access these, you will need to have completed the main game. So sharpen those skills again and let’s get rescuing.”

In addition to the levels, the update will add PlayStation 5 Pro support, allowing users to enjoy an improved version of the game featuring a “constant best resolution while still running at 60 frames per second.”

ASTRO BOT is available now for PlayStation 5.

Watch some gameplay footage of today’s level below.

Tick-Tock Shock

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 2/3/25 – 2/9/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/famitsu-sales-2-3-25-2-9-25

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Super Mario Party Jamboree moves back to the top spot.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of February 3, 2025 to February 9, 2025.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 43,672 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 14,408 units, the Xbox Series family sold 2,320 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 21 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) – 17,355 (1,175,272)
  2. [NSW] Donkey Kong Country Returns HD (Nintendo, 01/16/25) – 16,254 (180,696)
  3. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 10,263 (6,237,947)
  4. [PS5] Kingdom Come: Deliverance II (Deep Silver, 02/04/25) – 6,484 (New)
  5. [PS5] Black Myth: Wukong (Game Science, 01/30/25) – 5,636 (15,772)
  6. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 5,244 (8,068,328)
  7. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 4,817 (3,806,165)
  8. [PS5] Dynasty Warriors: Origins (Koei Tecmo, 01/17/25) – 4,723 (94,583)
  9. [NSW] Nintendo Switch Sports (Nintendo, 04/29/22) – 3,620 (1,544,320)
  10. [NSW] It Takes Two (Electronic Arts, 12/08/22) – 3,557 (120,365)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on February 14.

  1. [NSW] Super Smash Bros. Ultimate (Nintendo, 12/07/18) –
  2. [NSW] Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 11/14/24) –
  3. [PS5] Honkai: Star Rail Trailblazer Edition (miHoYo, 01/30/25) –
  4. [NSW] Tales of Graces f Remastered (Bandai Namco, 01/17/25) –
  5. [NSW] Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet (The Pokemon Company, 11/18/22) –
  6. [NSW] Ring Fit Adventure (Nintendo, 10/18/19) –
  7. [NSW] Cuisineer (Happinet, 01/28/25) –
  8. [NSW] ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist (Binary Haze Interactive, 01/23/25) –
  9. [PS5] Tales of Graces f Remastered (Bandai Namco, 01/17/25) –
  10. [NSW] Clubhouse Games: 51 Worldwide Classics (Nintendo, 06/05/20) –
  11. [NSW] The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom (Nintendo, 09/26/24) –
  12. [NSW] Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 Special Price (SEGA, 11/18/22) –
  13. [PS5] Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero (Nippon Ichi Software, 01/30/25) –
  14. [NSW] Super Mario Bros. Wonder (Nintendo, 10/20/23) –
  15. [NSW] Detective Pikachu Returns (The Pokemon Company, 10/06/23) –
  16. [NSW] Taiko no Tatsujin: Rhythm Festival (Bandai Namco, 09/22/22) –
  17. [NSW] Splatoon 3 (Nintendo, 09/09/22) –
  18. [NSW] The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom (Nintendo, 05/12/23) –
  19. [NSW] Guilty Gear: Strive (Arc System Works, 01/23/25) –

Hardware Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. Switch OLED Model – 29,886 (8,743,884)
  2. Switch Lite – 9,462 (6,444,419)
  3. PlayStation 5 – 7,227 (5,460,274)
  4. PlayStation 5 Pro – 5,137 (153,816)
  5. Switch – 4,324 (20,055,916)
  6. PlayStation 5 Digital Edition – 2,044 (913,784)
  7. Xbox Series X Digital Edition – 1,104 (18,918)
  8. Xbox Series S – 696 (330,241)
  9. Xbox Series X – 520 (317,793)
  10. PlayStation 4 – 21 (7,929,230)
